entries.title: Musk and Starship are now at center stage in NASA’s moon landing hopes
entries.description: SpaceX's president has assured NASA that Elon Musk's engagement with Twitter won't distract from its development of the Starship spacecraft.

entries.title: TikTok’s Chinese owner fires workers who gathered data on journalists
entries.description: In an attempt to identify who had shared internal documents with journalists from BuzzFeed and the Financial Times, workers on a ByteDance internal-audit team — two in China, two in the U.S. — pulled the reporters' IP addresses and other data.

entries.title: Bankman-Fried to be released on $250 million bond, live with parents
entries.description: The disgraced former cryptocurrency mogul will remain confined to his parents’ home in Palo Alto, Calif., until his Jan. 3 arraignment.

entries.title: Russian space agency may send rescue craft to space station
entries.description: The Russian space agency says it's trying to determine if the vehicle remains sound enough to bring the crew home in March.

entries.title: This plastic-foam-eating ‘superworm’ could help solve the garbage crisis
entries.description: As the garbage crisis escalates, scientists across the world are trying to find bacteria and bugs that consume trash. A Styrofoam-eating worm is the latest.

entries.title: Fake job postings are stealing applicants’ money and identities
entries.description: As layoffs continue, job seekers are becoming prime targets for employment scams. Here’s how to avoid falling for one.
